articles.title: How to use DMA to BSRR to set/reset leds on STM32 microcontorller?
articles.description: You can drive LEDs entirely from DMA by streaming 32-bit ‚Äúcommands‚Äù into the GPIOx->BSRR register. Each DMA write atomically sets and/or resets pins‚Äîno CPU toggling, no read-modify-write. Core idea BSRR (bit set/reset register): Bits [15:0] = set pins to 1 Bits [31:16] = reset pins to 0 So one 32-bit word can, in the same write, turn some LEDs on and others off. Example for PA5 (active-high LED): #define BSRR_SET(pin) (1u << (pin)) // lower half #define BSRR_RST(pin) (1u << ((pin) + 16)) // uppe
